args.natural_language_statement:
Show that if G = H_1 × H_2 × ... × H_n is the internal direct product of normal subgroups H_1, ..., H_n then for any i ≠ j we have H_i ∩ H_j = {1}.

Translate to Lean4. Use Mathlib import and end the theorem with := by sorry. Define an internal_direct_product predicate as unique factorization: every g : G has a unique tuple f : ∀ i, G with each f i ∈ H i and g = ∏ i, f i. Then state the theorem that for i ≠ j the intersection of H i and H j equals {1}.

args.content:
import Mathlib

open BigOperators

/-- If G = H_1 × ... × H_n is an internal direct product in the sense that
    every g : G has a unique tuple (h_i) with h_i ∈ H_i and g = ∏ i, h_i,
    then distinct factors intersect trivially. -/
theorem internal_direct_product_pairwise_intersection_trivial {G : Type _} [Group G]
  {n : Nat} (H : Fin n → Subgroup G)
  (h_unique : ∀ g : G, ∃! f : Fin n → G, (∀ i, f i ∈ H i) ∧ g = ∏ i, f i) :
  ∀ i j : Fin n, i ≠ j → ((H i : Set G) ∩ (H j : Set G)) = ({1} : Set G) := by
  sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open BigOperators

/-- If G = H_1 × ... × H_n is an internal direct product in the sense that
    every g : G has a unique tuple (h_i) with h_i ∈ H_i and g = ∏ i, h_i (here expressed
    as List.prod (List.ofFn f)), then distinct factors intersect trivially. -/
theorem internal_direct_product_pairwise_intersection_trivial {G : Type _} [Group G]
  {n : Nat} (H : Fin n → Subgroup G)
  (h_unique : ∀ g : G, ∃! f : Fin n → G, (∀ i, f i ∈ H i) ∧ g = List.prod (List.ofFn f)) :
  ∀ i j : Fin n, i ≠ j → ((H i : Set G) ∩ (H j : Set G)) = ({1} : Set G) := by
  sorry
